intro: Agathosma mucronulata var. rudolphii, commonly known as Rudolph's African geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. This variety is also valued for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated for essential oils.
